STRINGS: We quickly rushed to the scene.
Mr. Kazamori was familiar with the target from before already,
which he curtly alluded to in the car.
"I can't put up with that guy,
he's just trouble."
"What kind of trouble?"
"If I had to describe him in one word, it would be slug."
"S-slug?"
"He's got these weird fixations and hangups
that make him go on and on about this or that...
Not only that, but he only knows about the strangest things."
"Another issue of his is his paranoia.
The other day, I saw him and, rather than greet him,
I lightly tapped on his shoulder.
Now, how do you think that prick reacted?"
"Don't tell me, he tried extorting you with a
'you broke my shoulder bone' line..."
"Close, but not quite.
Dude suddenly grabbed my arm tight."
--Mr. Kazamori acted out the events
through full-body gestures as he spoke.
'You just tried laying your hand on my shoulder, right?'
'Yeah. Got a problem with that?
--Also, why're you grabbing my arm?'
'I know you are a police officer.
D-d-don't underestimate my information network, please.
'Huh? What didja say?
If you live in this town, I doubt you would somehow miss that out.'
'Regardless of whether you're on the job,
touching a
's body without permission
constitutes a criminal act. Fwihi...!'
'Fortunately, there's no bleeding, bu~t...
I can charge you with assault... fuhih!'
'Huh!? Do you even understand what you're saying?
Did worms eat your brain or something?'
'Ahi! Not only did you assault me, you humiliated me
and insulted m-m-my good name! I'm going to sue you for slander!'
'Huuuh!? Bring it on, asshat!
I'm ready for it, so go report me already, dumbass!'
"...And, what happened next?"
"That Kanaya bastard actually reported me.
Of course, they didn't bother to assemble an investigation,
but then, that idiot went and snitched to the prefectural HQ."
Despite it starting with just a light tap on the shoulder
with no ill will, it ended with him making a nuisance for HQ.
Still, this series of events attest to Kayana's manic personality.
"The prefectural police didn't lend him an ear as well,
so he called his family's lawyer and tried to sue
the Metropolitan Police Department or something.
Whatta moron. And why the MPD, too? It doesn't end there, though--"
"--Uhm, uh, Mr. Kazamori. Hold on for a second.
I'm asking this just in case, but
everything you told me actually happened, right?"
"Hey. You think I'm lying to ya?"
"No, it's just... it sounds like it came from a comic book.
Such a petty and farcical story is hard to believe, you know?"
"I get it. I felt the same way, too.
It's quite repulsive, isn't it?"
How do I put it? He's acting pretentiously,
like an Internet addict who doesn't understand how society works
and that didn't notice that they were in the real world.
Honestly, it very much gives me "Chuunibyou" vibes.
"I mean, it gives me the image of an idiot proudly showing off
the smattering knowledge they have."
"He knows how to bark but not how to bite.
So all he does is flail around endlessly.
Even so, once his proud's wounded, he makes a scene...
That's the impression he gives me."
The way to deal with those types is simple.
You have to make them understand who is superior here.
If need be, you might even have to browbeat them until they shut up.
However, we aren't allowed to use this method.
In that case, we must shut down his quibbling through some other way.
"At any rate, I doubt this Hiromu Kanaya will
honestly spill the beans to us.
How should we deal with this... hmm..."
"We can only see how it plays out when the time comes.
We're trying to get an interview out of him with just a few pictures
of him grinnin' among the gawkers as evidence, after all."
"Yeah..."
In other words, we cannot rule out the likelihood of
wasting our time from the moment we came up with this plan.
"One more thing. Don't call him stupid too many times in front of him.
'Cuz it's just gonna make things unnecessarily complicated."
"Roger. I'll be careful.
Also, if one of you pick up from where you left off last time,
let him know that's not how slander works, okay, Mr. Kazamori?"
"Wait, really!?"
We parked the car next to our destination, Kanaya's house.
Once we get off, the first thing we do is confirm its exterior.
As expected of a long-lasting family of land owners,
their house is an extremely large building.
Next to it stands a detached house on the smaller side of things.
"I wonder if he's in..."
"He's unemployed and an Internet addict, remember?
There's no way he's not in.
Let's go call him."
We shout from the entrance to the Kanaya property's main building.
Coming out from within was an old lady,
most likely Kanaya's grandmother.
When we asked to meet with him so we could have a talk,
she kindly told us he was on the neighboring house.
He has recently begun living in that detached building, she said.
We moved to the detached house's entrance,
where we called on him through the doorbell.
But there was no response even after we waited a while.
Without much choice, we repeatedly pressed the doorbell.
"He's absent... it seems."
"He's definitely just pretending to be out.
He just finds it bothersome to talk to people, I'm sure.
At times like these, you gotta..."
"Mister Kanaya? Mister Hiromu Kanaya!
Home delivery. Please come take your package."
"H-home delivery?"
"I want him to think we're here to deliver
an anime DVD or game software or whatever."
"There's no way that'll work..."
"You're joking?"
See, Mr. Kazamori vaunted through eye contact as we headed inside.
After he sluggishly opened the door,
the person in question looked dumbfounded.
"Home delivery... you are not."
"My bad. We just wanted to talk with you so much
I wound up telling a lie."
"Talk about what? Who are you people anyway?
Did my parents call someone again?
I told them it's not that I don't feel like working, leave me alone."
It appears he mistook us for recruiters
called by his worried parents.
Actually, it seems he forgot about Mr. Kazamori entirely.
This is rather convenient.
"No, we're nothing like that.
This is what we are."
Matching Kazamori's timing, I reached my hand into my pocket
just as he sunk his into his inner pocket.
Then we pulled out our police IDs simultaneously.
"The police...?"
"You know about this recent series of murders, correct?
We just want to ask you a few questions."
"I'm, kinda busy right now..."
"It won't take much time.
Think of it as helping the community solve a crime.
Please."
Kanaya made a troubled expression.
Looks like he wants to decline by any means possible.
"Er, what? Can't the police find a clue?
Have you finally given up and begun going around at random?"
"Yeah, can't deny that.
We want any leads, no matter how small."
"Hmph... I'm shocked the police are this useless.
The special programs they show on TV from time to time always
say our police is the best in the world.
Did the government and the TV channels just fake all that?"
Of course not--- I almost blurted out, but in that moment,
Mr. Kazamori's tapping on my shoulder brought me back to my senses.
"I don't know enough about that to say anything.
...More importantly, are you going to cooperate with us?"
"What do I get in return?"
"...Pardon?"
"I said, what do I get in return?
Did you really think I'd just give important information out for free?
Aren't you in trouble because you can't find any clues?"
"Then make a special advisor and I'll help you.
You can find all kinds of info on the Net, after all."
"I can search anywhere with my super hacking, too.
So, how much are you going to pay me?"
...How dare he ask for commission without even looking at us in the eye.
I wanted to strongly object, but I managed to contain myself.
"You want my help, don't you?
Then giving me at least a gift is only natural, right?
Don't tell me you came here empty-handed??"
--Without noticing, I began clenching my fist.
I wanted to smack him for being so shameless.
I now keenly understood how everything Mr. Kazamori said was true.
"Huh? Huh-huh-huh?
What's up with that fist? Your nails are digging into your hand.
Could it be that you're mad at me?"
"It's not that, not at all... right, Mr. Kazamori?"
"Y-yeah."
"Oh-oh-oh, I got you good. Now there's some evidence.
If you do anything to me, I think I'm going to upload it to my blog."
--This fat pig.
I can't do it. I'm sorry, Mr. Kazamori,
but this man disgusts me on a whole other level.
Unless we can make this obnoxious man and
his filthy mouth that oozes with nonsense submit to us,
I very much doubt we'll be able to attain our goal.
"Er, sorry, Mr. Kazamori.
But I think it's about time we got to the point."
"A-alright.
Just do what ya do best."
"Thank you... now then,"
--As soon as I said that, I grabbed him by his collar.
